{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63388].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting issues that contain inward issue link, there is no column for Inward issue link in the export .csv file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue A and B
# Link issue A to B (e.g _relates to_ link)
# Search for issue A and B in issue navigator
# Export these issues by using _Export Excel CSV/ CSV_ via the export feature

h3. Expected Results
The CSV file should have both _Inward issue link_ and Outward issue link_

h3. Actual Results
The CSV file contains only _Outward issue link_
 
h3. Notes
In https://<instance_name>/secure/admin/ViewLinkTypes!default.jspa, both Inward and Outward Description for *Relates* link are using *relates to*
* Export to Excel was deprecated and replaced by the _Export to CSV_ function in Jira 7.2,so only the _Export to CSV_ part of this bug is still valid.

h3.Workaround
* You can use REST API to extract the information and then convert the JSON format to CSV or a more user friendly format: [How to export issues and their links via JSON instead of CSV|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-articles/How-to-export-issues-and-their-links-via-JSON-instead-of-CSV/ba-p/940548#M13].
** Full credit to [~amir.katz] for this workaround.
fields.summary: Export Excel CSV/CSV does not export the Inward issue link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63384].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how your teams work and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We have decided to close this specific request for _additional status categories_ as Won't Fix. The finite set of status categories allows us to build useful features on top of them, like completion progress indicators for Epics and Versions.

We recognize that for many teams, most of the steps in a workflow are "In Progress" and that it can be difficult to distinguish them. Here are some strategies:
* Add additional columns to your board for different workflow states. You can have several "In Progress" columns to represent concepts like "In Development" or "Under Review".
* Use the card colors based on JQL queries feature ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-colours]) to define your own colors for workflow states. I've created this suggestion in the JIRA Agile project to improve this in the future: GHS-11666
* Use JIRA Agile card layouts (new in JIRA Agile 6.6) to show the workflow state on the card ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-fields])
* To customize the display of issues within the JIRA issue navigator, consider the free third-party [icnavigator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icnavigator.jira-icnavigator] from Interconcept GmbH.

We do not plan to support arbitrary colors for status categories. The mapping of blue, yellow, and green to "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" is part of [Atlassian's overall visual system|https://design.atlassian.com/latest/product/components/lozenges/]. Our intent is to improve how we use this pattern to communicate information in JIRA; however, we use the combination of colors and lozenges to represent concepts not only in JIRA, but across Atlassian's product suite.

Finally, there were specific requests for a "Red" status color. The main use case here was situations where an issue had progressed to the end of a workflow, but the resolution was negative (e.g. "Failed" instead of "Done"). In JIRA's structure, this connects the final workflow state (i.e. "Resolved") with the type of resolution. While there's certainly merit in this request, it has the potential to significantly increase JIRA's complexity.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

The new status colors in JIRA provides initial set of pre-defined statues. It would also be beneficial to add the ability for users to add more categories to it
fields.summary: Ability to add more categories to statuses

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When accessing JIRA using The Activity Stream gadget is appending the text "Activity Streams" at the end of entries that are coming from linked applications, like Confluence. The issue does not happen for entries coming from JIRA itself.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup an application link between JIRA and another application, such as Confluence.
# Add the Activity Stream gadget on a dashboard and include the external source.
# Access JIRA using Microsoft Edge browser and note the text "Activity Streams" appearing right before the activity (see screenshot below):
!ActivityStream-01.png|thumbnail!

h4. Work-around
Use another browser.

(i) This bug was tested on JIRA 7.2.5 and the latest Microsoft Edge version as of November 30th. On other browsers this problem is not noticeable.
fields.summary: Activity Stream entries for linked applications are incorrectly showing when accessing JIRA using Microsoft Edge browser

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Add On Users Should be Removed When instance is Exported From Cloud to Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a cloud instance that has a plugin installed that creates the atlassian-addons-project-access role
 # Import to Server instance

h3. Expected Results

The atlassian-addons-project-access role should be removed during the downgrade to Server
h3. Actual Results

The role still exists
h3. Workaround
 - Navigate to *Administration > System > Project Role Browser*
 - Click *Delete* next to the *atlassian-addons-project-access* role to remove it.
fields.summary: Add On Users Should be Removed When Instance is Exported From Cloud and imported to Server

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating a JIRA backup using Internet Explorer never presents the link with the create file to be downloaded, it's just stuck at the "_Exporting data_" message or "_Please wait_" message if the page is refreshed.
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud version 1000.586.0
Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Internet Explorer 11 go to JIRA administration > System > Backup manager
# Click the Create backup for Cloud or Server buttons

h3. Expected Results
After the contents are exported a link should be presented to download the backup file.

h3. Actual Results
The page is stuck with the "_Exporting files_" message and if the page is refreshed the message changes to "_Please wait_" but the link to download the files never appears

h3.Workaround
Using another modern browser like Firefox, Chrome or Edge, access the Backup Manager page and you should see the link to download the file there.
fields.summary: Creating a JIRA backup using Internet Explorer never presents the link to download the file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63379].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
According to the [User management REST API changes in JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/User+management+REST+API+changes+in+JIRA+Cloud] documentation the "_Change user password_" endpoint was removed because these APIs create, modify or delete user attributes and passwords, which are no longer managed by the JIRA tenant with the rollout of Atlassian account and SSO. 
h3. Suggested Solution
At the end of that documentation it says that "_Atlassian accounts cannot be managed via public APIs today. We are currently evaluating how best to expose these capabilities in a secure manner that best meets our customers' use cases._"
This request is to track the re-implementation of such endpoint.
h3. Why this is important
This removal breaks some functionalities of some services like Okta.
fields.summary: Bring back the "Change user password" REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA does not send notification to the component leads if the issue is created with multiple components.

How to reproduce:

# Create 2 components. For example {{Test A}} and {{Test B}}.
# Assign different components leads for each of the components.
# Add {{Component Leads}} for the {{Issue Create}} notification.
# Create a new issue with Test A and Test B as components.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2.5, 7.2.4, 7.1.8


h3. Expected Results

JIRA sends notification to the all the component leads of the components added to the issues during the issue creation.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA only send notification for the first component lead.For example, if Test A and Test B components are added, JIRA will always send notification for the component Test A's component lead only.


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: JIRA does not send notification for multiple component leads

{panel}
h3. Summary

Workflow in issue won't load.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Go to any existing issues
 # Click on *View Workflow*

h3. Expectation

The project's workflow is displayed
h3. Actual Result

Spinning wheels loading endlessly

We can see this error in the browser's console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: this.html.droppable is not a function(…)init {noformat}
h3. Cause

Recent changes in JIRA are causing the Tempo add-on to manifest this error when Tempo Timesheets is disabled.
h3. Workaround

Renew the license for the Tempo Add-on OR Disable / Uninstall the tempo Add-on, and the system plug-in dependencies

Exe: Testing With Tempo Planner the add installs all the following add-ons that must all be manually disabled:
{code:java}
Tempo Planner
System Plugin: Tempo Teams
System Plugin: Tempo Planning API
System Plugin: Tempo Core
System Plugin: Tempo Accounts
{code}
Testing with Tempo Timesheets the following add-ons that must all be manually disabled:
{code:java}
Tempo Timesheets
System Plugin: Tempo Teams
System Plugin: Tempo Planning API
System Plugin: Tempo Core
System Plugin: Tempo Accounts{code}
fields.summary: Workflow view within issue does not load

h3. Summary
When Project Administrator without Global Administrator permissions edits available configuration options under *Project Settings* >> *Details* any preconfigured Project category is deleted

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.2.X

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log in as user with Project admin and without Global Admin
* Navigate to a project that has a *Project category* configured by global admin
** *Desired Project* >> *Project Settings* >> *Details*
* Edit any of the available fields  and save (Name, URL, Avatar, Description) 
* OR Without editing any options just select save details

*Project Category* is not changed as the user does not have permission to alter this field

h3. Actual Results
*Project Category* is set to NONE

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time

When a project administrator (not JIRA administrator) changes a project avatar it resets the project category. The project category field is read-only, so there is no workaround by f.e. setting the project category manually.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 * Login as a project administrator (role administrator for a project)
 * Go to project
 * Click project settings
 * Click details
 * Select different avatar
 * Save

 

Expected result:
 * Project category is still the same

 

Actual result:
 * Project category is "none"

 

JIRA version is 7.2.5

h3. Summary
When importing issues via the CSV Importer, attachments that are defined with {code}-{code} in front of the name in both the CSV and file name will have the {code}-{code} removed when attached into JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 pdf files and store them in your JIRA attachments directory:
#* test.pdf
#* -test2.pdf
# Create a importable JIRA CSV file to include the attachments fields "test.pdf" and "-test2.pdf". (A CSV file is attached into this ticket as an example)
# Perform the CSV import.

h3. Expected Results
The attachments will be attached as "*test.pdf*" and "*-test2.pdf*"

h3. Actual Results
The attachments are attached as "*test.pdf*" and "*test2.pdf*"
fields.summary: CSV Import ignores "-" in the begin of the attachment name.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63365].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Linking between epics and story (or epic and initiave) requires Edit issue permission for both issue, since it's updating issue fields. This limits the admin's ability to restrict this permission (to be able to link epics) to specific user.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a separate permission for this action. 

h5. Workaround 
If you do not wish to give the users permissions to edit issue in the project where epics are created, you may consider one of the following options:
* Manage field-level permissions in the "program" project via ScriptRunner Behaviours. Note this will introduce additional complexity to your setup.
* Create an issue link type to simulate the epic assignment (is parent epic of /is epic child of) and add an automation rule via Automation for Jira with an issue linked trigger. This way, you may only grant users the linking permissions and not all edit permissions and let the automation user set the actual "Epic Link" field.
* Move all epics to a separate project (that's reserved only for epics) and make them editable by all users in linked projects.
fields.summary: Separate permission for Epic link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63359].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
There is a bug on the integration between IDEs like Webstorm and JIRA, although the support for IDE in JIRA was discontinued.

The bug was reported originally in our JIRA support site to be fixed since when using this integration our users were being logged out of JIRA.You can see the bug reported here:
[JRA-42154|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42154]

Since this issue was related to a connector, the bug was moved to the Connector's project:
[PL-3051|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PL-3051]

https://developer.atlassian.com/blog/2015/06/discontinuing-ide-connectors-support/

h3. Suggestion

Add any kind of compatibility or feature where the user does not face the login intermittent issue when making API calls to JIRA.

h3. Workarounds

*I was able to find some workarounds on my research that might be useful, although it's necessary an additional license in JIRA, which is inconvenient for our customers*

- Change the password of your own account, so if an unknown app / service was using your account and destroying the sessions it no longer could
- Create a dedicated account and use it credentials to connect Webstorm and Jira. In this way, Webstorm could no longer destroy the sessions of your own account.
- You can upgrade to snapshot versions in the Global Settings -> General -> Auto Upgrade section of the connector's configuration. (This workaround was suggested PL-3051 comments).
fields.summary: Compatibility between JIRA and Webstorm IDE

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63356].
  {panel}

It would be great if we could write custom queries that utilize other custom queries.

It would allow us to write modular queries.

Example:

JQL1: (status not in (Resolved, Closed) AND originalEstimate is EMPTY OR status in (Open, Reopened, "In Progress") AND remainingEstimate = 0) AND type != Epic

JQL2: Project = DEV and +JQL1+

JQL3: Project = APP and +JQL1+

...

JQLn: Project = n and +JQL1+

 

Such capability will allow us to make changes to JQL1 without the need of updating JQL2 - JQLn

This is invaluable specially if such custom filters are used in dashboards.

 

Thanks for considering it.
fields.summary: JQL Filter (query) using custom filter (query)

fields.description:
PermissionSchemeService.assignPermissionSchemeToProject() uses a converter in the following call:
permissionSchemeManager.addSchemeToProject(project, representationConverter.scheme(scheme));

This converter creates a scheme with SCHEME_TYPE = "permission".

Assigning the scheme fires an event, which is processed in the SchemeEventHandlerImpl.onSchemeAddedToProject().

This method does a map lookup:
SchemeDetail details = schemeDetails.get(event.getScheme().getType());
and expects a non-null result.

The problem is that the "schemeDetails" map expects the event type to be called:
DefaultSchemeFactory.PERMISSION_SCHEME = "PermissionScheme".

This effectively causes a NullPointerException.

tl;dr: PermissionSchemeRepresentationConverter.SCHEME_TYPE doesn't match the values in DefaultSchemeFactory, which is a bug.
fields.summary: PermissionSchemeService.assignPermissionSchemeToProject() throws NullPointerException

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The default font color (when you select from the text color selection) is "red". See:
 !red.png! 

But once another font color is chosen (other than red), you can no longer select red anymore. Clicking on red actually produced #d04437 instead:
 !d.png! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clear browser caches
# Login with a new user
# Either edit the description of an issue, or add a comment to an issue
# Highlight some text, and change its color to red via the text color selector. Notice that it is the correct color on the text now (color set to red)
# Highlight another block of text and change its color to blue. 
# Now highlight another block of text and change its color to red again. Notice that it's the wrong color now (color set to #d04437 )

h3. Expected Results
Color should be set back to "red". 

h3. Actual Results
Color is set to #d04437 , and it will be that color forever, in the text color selector no matter where you go (editing another issue, add a comment to another issue, etc. It will never go back to red unless you clear your browser caches and site data - including cookies)

h3.Workaround
Clear all the browser caches and site data, including cookies. Otherwise, just manually change #d04437 to "red"
fields.summary: Text color changes from red to #d04437

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing *custom fields* using the *Edit Screen* will delete the data for any *Text Fields (read only)* custom fields which are included in the 'Edit Issue' screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a text custom field (e.g. rw-text-field).
# Create a {{Text Field (read only))}} custom field.
# Add both fields to the 'Create Issue' and 'Edit Issue' screen for a project.
# Create a new issue programmatically (e.g. using the REST API) setting both fields during creation.
# After the issue is created, edit the {{rw-text-field}} field using the 'Edit Screen'.

h3. Expected Results
Only the Text Field is updated with the latest changes.

h3. Actual Results
* All existing *Text Field (read only)* fields included in the 'Edit Screen' are cleared.
* Their data is purged from the DB.
* The change log does not document this change so it might even go unnoticed (e.g. if the field is in a tab).

h3. Workaround
* Associate read-only text fields only to the 'Create Issue' screen and remove their association from the 'Edit Issue' screens.
** This change will prevent the field from being updated via the REST API, except when the issue is created.
* Update the Custom Field type to Writeable Text Field following the steps in [Changing Custom Field Types in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-custom-field-types-in-jira-158357.html]

h3. Notes
* Using the in-line editing won't cause this problem, but this is not be possible for fields without a value.
fields.summary: Read-only Text Fields in the Edit Screen will be cleared when the issue is edited

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some gadgets and reports may cause a heavy increase in JIRA's memory footprint due to inneficient {{OneDimensionalObjectHitCollector}} caching. 
This may cause the application to crash after entering into a Full GC loop or to throw OutOfMemoryErrors.

Afftected gadgets / reports:
* [Created vs Resolved gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-created-vs-resolved-gadget-720416880.html]
* [Single Level Group By Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/single-level-group-by-report-720416042.html]

h4. Created vs Resolved:
The Created vs Resolved gadget is loading all created and resolved fields into an array. 
For big instance with a lot of issues this require creating arrays that can hold almost all the issues in the system.
Those arrays are treated by G1GC as humongous objects and leads to, inefficiency in GC, memory fragmentation and makes this gadget very slow.
Memory footprint is not dependent on the query nor on the reporting period, it only affected by size of biggest segment in Lucene index. 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Generate instance with 130k issues and memory of 1.5GB.
 # Configure G1GC to use 1MB segments with the following JVM flags: {{-XX:UseG1GC}} {{-XX:G1HeapRegionSize=1m}}. This allows to trigger humongous allocation with a limited data set. Also set the following flags to allow GC logging: {{-XX:+PrintGCDetails}} {{-XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps}} {{-XX:+PrintReferenceGC}} {{-XX:+PrintAdaptiveSizePolicy}}
 # Perform a lock & re-index operation.
 # Create a dashboard with a *Resolved vs Closed* gadget on it.
 # Capture the URL that was used for generating content of the gadget (something containing createdVsResolved), copied this as curl from chrome dev tools
 # Create loop that hits this URL constantly.
 # Observe in GC log:
{code:java}016-11-24T12:57:31.463+0000: 963.481: [GC pause (G1 Humongous Allocation) (young) (initial-mark) 963.481: [G1Ergonomics (CSet Construction) start choosing CSet, _pending_cards: 653, predicted base time: 21.10 ms, remaining time: 178.90 ms, target pause time: 200.00 ms]{code}

h4. Single Level Group By Report
*Steps to reproduce*
# Generate an instance with 100k issues and memory of 1GB.
# When running this report, select a filter containing all issues.
# Inspecting the [Garbage Collection logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-garbage-collection-logs-to-analyze-jira-application-performance-227416009.html], several Full GCs should be visible, even when using G1GC.
# Taking a thread dump during this period, while the report is loading, should reveal the stuck thread below:
{noformat}
"http-bio-8349-exec-24" #569 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f2fb0002000 nid=0x38f6 runnable [0x00007f2f473f9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at org.apache.lucene.store.DataInput.readString(DataInput.java:182)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldsReader.addField(FieldsReader.java:431)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldsReader.doc(FieldsReader.java:261)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.document(SegmentReader.java:471)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryReader.document(DirectoryReader.java:564)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.document(IndexReader.java:844)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.util.OneDimensionalDocIssueHitCollector.getDocument(OneDimensionalDocIssueHitCollector.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.util.OneDimensionalDocIssueHitCollector.collectWithTerms(OneDimensionalDocIssueHitCollector.java:50)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.util.AbstractOneDimensionalHitCollector.collect(AbstractOneDimensionalHitCollector.java:190)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:482)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:184)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.searchMapIssueKeys(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:96)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.getOptions(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.generateReportHtml(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:125)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.ConfigureReport.doExecute(ConfigureReport.java:156)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:88)        
        (...)
{noformat}
# Capturing a [heap dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-memory-dumps-to-analyze-outofmemoryerrors-227416007.html] should reveal a very large object referenced by such thread.

h3. Expected results
No excessive amount of arrays containing all issues on the instance is created. GC operations are not impacted.

h3. Actual results
JIRA allocates several arrays that might contain all issues on the instance. Increased memory pressure can trigger Full GC operations, decreasing the instance responsiveness.

h3. Workaround
*Single Level Group By Report*: Reduce the number of issues in the filter configured in the report.
fields.summary: Inneficient caching for OneDimensionalObjectHitCollector may cause out of memory errors

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA [Core Boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html] are now available in the Cloud envionrmnt.  It would be nice to be able to configure the Cards to show additional information like you can in a [JIRA Software|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html#Customizingcards-fieldsAddingfieldstocards].

Enable JIRA Software

h3. Summary

Clicking on the profile menu items (My JIRA Home) requires two clicks instead of one
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the Profile icon menu on the top-right of JIRA
 # Click ‘Boards’ (and Boards will now be set correctly to the location you go to if you only type the site URL for JIRA) !My JIRA Home menu.png|thumbnail!

h5. Description

If the JIRA Base URL is set to HTTP, but an user access it via HTTPS (over a secondary connector), the avatars will be loaded using a non-secure connection. This can trigger a warning on browsers due to mixed-content being delivered.

h5. Suggestion
Force the avatars to be delivered via HTTPS when JIRA is accessed via a secure connection.

(i) This is similar to JRA-60301
fields.summary: Force avatars to be loaded via secure connection despite of Base URL

h3. Problem Definition
When going to a user's profile on JIRA anyone can see in the activity stream the time the this user has logged on issues.
h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option to filter this activity stream and remove the logged work from it.
h3. Why this is important
Some projects may require a certain level of confidentiality when it comes to work logged on issues, user wise.

h3. Problem Definition
Almost of time customer will follow the [Upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Upgrading+JIRA+applications] page to upgrade their JIRA instance.
However for JIRA Software 7.2.x and JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x, there is a minimum version required (7.0.0 for JIRA Software and 3.0.0 for JIRA Service Desk) in order to upgrade to the latest version. This information is currently  only available on the upgrade notes page of each application which could be easily ignored by the customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the minimum version required for JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk to the Upgrading JIRA applications page.

h3. Summary

Clicking the graph from Project gadget from dashboard will show Issue Navigator with empty result

Steps to reproduce:

# From Dashboard, add the Project gadget with {{Detailed}} view.
# Click on any graph shown beside the graph. 
# JIRA will redirect user to Issue Navigator with empty result.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2.5


h3. Expected Results

One of the example of the URL shown from gadget is : {{http://localhost:8725/vicky/issues/?/issues/?jql=project+%3D+SKP+AND+resolution+is+EMPTY+AND+priority+%3D+%225%22}}
JIRA should display Issue Navigator with result of {{project+%3D+SKP+AND+resolution+is+EMPTY+AND+priority+%3D+%225%22}} JQL query


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows Issue Navigator with empty result.
This happens because the {{http://localhost:8725/vicky/issues/?/issues/?jql=project+%3D+SKP+AND+resolution+is+EMPTY+AND+priority+%3D+%225%22}} URL contains {{/issues/?/issues/?}} entry twice.


h3.Workaround

Manually remove the {{/issues/?/}} from the graph result URL.
fields.summary: Broken link from Project Gadget's Graph

As stated in JRA-41413 , SHA-1 will be deprecated soon, thus, we should also update this guide to not ask user to use SHA-1 as the hashing algo

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63289].
  {panel}

What happened:

I have a session open in my browser for JIRA Core 7.2.1, viewing the issues in a project, with one issue's details available. After some time I decide to view and attachment and click it.

Expected result:

Attachment displays

Actual result:

I get an error state saying JIRA can't show the attachment and I need to download it. I download it, and the download is the HTML of the JIRA login screen.

Cause:

My session has expired

Workaround:

Login and try again

Suggestion:

We should really handle this scenario more gracefully. A correct error stating you can't preview the attachment as you're no longer logged in would be better.
fields.summary: JIRA fails to preview an attachment and downloads the HTML for the login page

In the *Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS* documentation:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Running+JIRA+applications+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the drag and drop functionality to attach a file to a JIRA issue, multiple copies of that single attachment will get automatically attached to the issue.
!multipleattchements.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.4.x
Firefox 50.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Spin up or already possess a JIRA 6.4.x instance.
# Open a Firefox 50.0 browser
# Edit an issue in your JIRA instance
# Drag and drop a file into the issue

h3. Expected Results
A single attachment will be loaded into the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Multiple copies of the same attachment are loaded into the issue.

h3. Workaround
Option #1:  Use another supported browser
Option #2:  Upgrade JIRA to a 7.0.x or above
Option #3:  Delete the additional copies of the attachment from the issue
Option #4: Use the manual upload method of adding attachments
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Attachments attaches multiple copies of a single attachment with Firefox 50.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63285].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When using [this configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Creating+issues+and+comments+from+email#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-handytips] to allow non-JIRA users to create or comment on issues by email (by setting a _default reporter_):
 - JIRA only accepts the user to add comment on existing issues by adding the _Issue Key_ in the subject of the message -> *Expected behavior*
 - However, When trying to raise a new ticket by email, the message is rejected with the following entries in _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log_, if the email address of the sender is associated to an account in Jira which is either inactive or does not have a license (no application access) -> *Unexpected behavior*
{noformat}
Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Allow anonymous access to your project per [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project]
 # Configure your mail handler as [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Creating+issues+and+comments+from+email#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-handytips]
 # Send an email out to JIRA's mail handler

h3. Expected Behavior

The issue is created with the _default reporter_ according to the mail handler configurations, regardless of the sender of the email is associated to a Jira account or not.
h3. Actual Behavior

No issue is created and the following entries appear in _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log,_ due to the fact that the mail handler mapped the email address to the existing account, and ignored the _default reporter_ configuration:
{noformat}
Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Remove the users impacted from the Jira user base so they can became a real anonymous user so Jira will create the tickets using the Default Reporter configured
 *_OR_*
 * Give application access to the users trying to create tickets through the mail channel (you must keep in mind that this will consume a new license for each user that is being granted an application access)

h3. Notes

This issue is not reproducible when the user is adding a new comment to an issue by specifying the Issue Key in the message's subject. That is, the message is added as a comment on the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA does not create issue by email with the default reporter, if the sender is associated to an user who is inactive or does not have a license

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you initiate full locked reindexing through REST API {{/rest/api/2/reindex?type=FOREGROUND}}, *nodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1* at the same node still tries to read operations from {{replicatedindexoperation}} and fails. This spams the logs and lead to data inconsistency. 

h3. Environment
* 2 JIRA DC nodes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start both JIRA nodes
# Initiate full locked reindex at Node1: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl  -X POST http://127.0.0.1:8091/rest/api/2/reindex?type=FOREGROUND
{code}
# Modify some issues at Node2

h3. Expected Results
Node1 will ignore messages in {{replicatedindexoperation}} table and does do index reconciliation. 

h3. Actual Results
Thread {{nodeReindexServiceThread:thread1}} tries to read messages from {{replicatedindexoperation}} table and you can see following in the logs:
{noformat}
2016-11-22 17:48:29,105 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:794)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$600(DefaultIndexManager.java:88)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1118)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:780)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:533)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:438)
        ... 3 filtered
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy11.reIndexIssueObjects(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateIssueIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:404)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:298)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-11-22 17:48:29,106 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Could not reindex: com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueObjectIssuesIterable (2 items): [PRG-4, PRG-6]
{noformat}
Please note {{nodeReindexServiceThread:thread1}} doesn't have any chance to obtain the lock as Reindex is running at the same time:
{noformat}
2016-11-22 17:48:28,462 IssueIndexer:thread-9 INFO admin     [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing is 99% complete. Current index: Issue
{noformat}

h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
Don't use REST API and use JIRA UI to initiate the reindexing.
fields.summary: Reindex triggered though REST API doesn't stop NodeReindexServiceThread

h3. Summary

The dropdown in the "your time zone does not match" flag is not showing up on top of the flag as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your computer's time zone to something that is different from your JIRA server time zone and JIRA time zone user preference
# Go to the JIRA Dashboard 
# Wait for the time zone flag to pop up
# Select "Update your JIRA preference" option on the flag

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown containing time zones pops up over the flag. I can select any option.

h3. Actual Results

The dropdown containing time zones pops up underneath the flag. I can only see options not obstructed by the time zone flag, or any other flags.

h3.Workaround

Set the timezone preference in the user preferences page.
fields.summary: Time zone "update your preference" dropdown is not correctly layered

fields.description:
Trying to do a javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse#sendRedirect with an absolute url (which is perfecty valid according to the spec), might cause JIRA to try to forward to that redirect instead.

This seems to be caused by {{com.atlassian.jira.web.JiraForwardAuthorizer}} chosing the url to be forwarded rather than redirected (which is fine-ish), and {{com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingResponse#resolveLocation}} not handling absolute urls at all, deciding to forward to the absolute url.

 
h3. Actual result

The result is a 404. We've hit it when doing redirection after a redirect.

 
h3. Expected result

Normal re-direct happens.

 
h3. Workaround
 * Include setting the magic SEND_REDIRECT_ONGOING attribute
 * avoid doing absolute redirects.
fields.summary: Trying to do HttpServletResponse.sendRedirect to an absolute dashboard url causes a 404

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * disallow 3rd party cookies in Chrome
 * use issue collector on your local instance of JIRA (or for example on bitbucket.org)
 * observe js exceptions

 

After all exceptions there's a flag: "We noticed that you have third-party cookies disabled in your browser, we need this enabled to correctly submit your information." however we should catch the following:

 

Exception:
{quote}Uncaught DOMException: Failed to read the 'sessionStorage' property from 'Window': Access is denied for this document.(…)
{quote}
 

Stack trace (from /* module-key = 'jira.webresources:util', location = '/includes/jira/data/SessionStorage.js' */)
{code:java}getItem (batch.js?locale=en-UK:1373)
(anonymous function) (batch.js?locale=en-UK:1379) 
(anonymous function) (batch.js?locale=en-UK:1379) 
main (batch.js?locale=en-UK:19) 
callDep (batch.js?locale=en-UK:19) 
req (batch.js?locale=en-UK:19) 
window.require (batch.js?locale=en-UK:22) 
(anonymous function) (batch.js?locale=en-UK:1379) 

{code}
Links:

[https://www.chromium.org/for-testers/bug-reporting-guidelines/uncaught-securityerror-failed-to-read-the-localstorage-property-from-window-access-is-denied-for-this-document]

[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24456891/iframe-in-chrome-error-uncaught-securityerror-failed-to-read-the-sessionstora]

 

*Update:*

Chrome throws Security Exception for cross-origin iframes, therefore you can observe the bug on bitbucket.org or your local instance since the iframe source comes from jdog or JAC.

`SessionStorage` is a dependency for `jira.webresources:util` which is inside super batch, which is loaded within iframe.

I've checked the code and it wasn't changed for several years, so for sure the bug exists in JIRA 7.2.
fields.summary: Issue collector might throw a lot of JS exceptions when 3rd party cookies are disallowed

h3. Summary

 Could not change the password for the user from Active Directory configured to use insecure connection.
h3. Environment

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Active Directory with at least one user, and configure the directory to use insecure connection
 # Change the password of that user

h3. Expected Results

either:

if this operation should be allowed: a) password should be changed

if this operation is not supported by Active Directory with insecure connection: b) show more accurate message
h3. Actual Results

The password has not been changed.

Attached screenshot one can find the error.
h3. Notes

The following error might indicate that the problem lies in insecure connection:
{noformat}javax.naming.OperationNotSupportedException: [LDAP: error code 53 - 0000001F: SvcErr: DSID-031A0FC0, problem 5003 (WILL_NOT_PERFORM), data 0
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

Use secure connection in Active Directory.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63271].
  {panel}

In a connect add-on right now there's now way to check if groups are enabled in the comment level security (there's a global setting in JIRA to control this).

AFAICT none of the many JIRA configuration/setting/application-property REST APIs return what this is set to.  

Should probably be added to https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/configuration.

It's a problem because when we render this control, we don't know if we should allow group selection, and if we do then comment creation might fail if groups are turned off in JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to check if groups are enabled in comment security level

h3. Problem Definition
The deprecation of the Version Tab Panel as per [this documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/version-tab-panel-plugin-module] after 7.1 removes the previous capability to extend JIRA's version page with custom tabs. The [suggestion to migrate to the new web-item based approach of integrating with JIRA's new project centric view|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-general-changes#JIRA7.0-Generalchanges-deprecatedprojecttabpanels] works but greatly impacts usability. This change will now force users to move out of JIRA's native versions page to navigate to the add-ons menus to find version related functionality provided by plugins.

h3. Suggested Solution
Reconsider a way to allow plugging in add-on functionality in the relevant contexts with the new project centric navigation as well. Basically to strike a balance between the simplicity of the new project centric navigation, and the usability, functionality of the old project tab panels.

h3. Why this is important
The [suggestion to migrate to the new web-item based approach of integrating with JIRA's new project centric view|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-general-changes#JIRA7.0-Generalchanges-deprecatedprojecttabpanels] does work but greatly impacts usability. It forces users to navigate out of JIRA's native versions page to navigate to the add-ons menus to find version related functionality provided by plugins, which is not very intuitive or user friendly.
fields.summary: The deprecation of the Version Tab Panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When upgrading to JIRA 7, startup fails due to an exception while starting the scheduler, reporting that it does not recognize the type of schedule data it finds.

It reports {{"Unsupported schedule type: I"}} or {{"Unsupported schedule type: C"}} both of which are supported schedule types (interval and cron expression, respectively). The problem is caused by the column having an unexpected type and therefore including an unexpected trailing space character in its value.

h3. Environment

 * SQLServer
 * Upgrading to JIRA 7 from a previous version
 * A specific character encoding may be required to trigger this (uncertain)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Install a JIRA version prior to JIRA 7 on SQLServer
 # Attempt an upgrade to JIRA 7

h3. Expected Results

 # JIRA starts normally

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
 2016-08-30 09:12:12,057 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [c.atlassian.jira.ComponentManager] Error occurred while starting component 'com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager'.
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported schedule type: I
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.ClusteredJobFactory.badType(ClusteredJobFactory.java:131)
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.ClusteredJobFactory.toScheduleType(ClusteredJobFactory.java:111)
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.ClusteredJobFactory.getSchedule(ClusteredJobFactory.java:70)
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.ClusteredJobFactory.build(ClusteredJobFactory.java:42)
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.ClusteredJobFactory.build(ClusteredJobFactory.java:21)
 at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.forEach(SelectQueryImpl.java:231)
 at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.consumeWith(SelectQueryImpl.java:214)
 at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.singleValue(SelectQueryImpl.java:191)
 at com.atlassian.jira.scheduler.OfBizClusteredJobDao.find(OfBizClusteredJobDao.java:88)
 ...
{noformat}

and the JIRA startup fails.
  
h3. Notes

 * This column is supposed to be of type {{NCHAR(1)}}
 * For reasons that aren't completely clear, it is being set to {{NCHAR(2)}}
 * The {{ClusteredJobFactory}} class should probably tolerate trailing whitespace when loading this field, but it does not.

h3. Workaround
 * Alter the "clusteredjob.sched_type" column, setting its data type to {{NCHAR(1)}}
fields.summary: ClusteredJobFactory fails to recognize job types after JIRA 7 upgrade on SQLServer

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we use German translation in JIRA by changing the language some of the words does not change properly but still remains in English for example

# when we run reindexing the time still shows in English *2 minutes 50 seconds*
# The final statement in which contains "Heute". This word is only then capitalized when it stands at the beginning of a sentence, after a colon, or when it stands for the present. It has to lower case here.
#  Representation of the time needs to be fixed. A correct expression of time would be, for this case: 12:40 Uhr.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the existing German translation so that there is less or no cosmetic error in future
fields.summary: Improve German Translation in JIRA
